summary: The Caring for Survivors Act of 2025 amends Title 38 of the United States Code to improve and expand eligibility for dependency and indemnity compensation for survivors of certain veterans. It increases the amount of compensation for surviving spouses, tied to a percentage of the monthly compensation for veterans, and modifies requirements for compensation for survivors of veterans rated totally disabled at the time of death, considering the length of time the veteran was totally disabled. The bill also includes provisions for individuals eligible for dependents and survivors income security benefits based on veterans who died before January 1, 1993.
